@weiguo-nvidia I remember for same action like skip or xfail, conditional mark would use the longest prefix to cover shorter prefix. Which means in the following skip and xfail decap test cases like `decap/test_decap.py::test_decap[ttl=pipe, dscp=pipe, vxlan=disable]`, your change may covered by `"'t0-isolated-d256u256s2' in topo_name and platform in ['x86_64-nvidia_sn5640-r0']"`. But for `decap/test_decap.py::test_decap[ttl=uniform, dscp=pipe, vxlan=disable]`, there is no xfail condition so your change would work. Could you check the needed scope of your xfail?
@wangxin please correct me if I'm wrong.

I tried to run test_bgp_update_timer.py with this PR on FT2-64 topo with Arista-7060X6-64PE-B-P64, and the test has the following error:
```shell
ERR bgp#bgpcfgd: command execution returned 13. Command: '['vtysh', '-f', '/tmp/tmpj7nleu7u']', stdout: '[1553|mgmtd] sending configuration#012[1554|zebra] sending configuration#012[1560|bgpd] sending configuration#012[1570|staticd] sending configuration#012Waiting for children to finish applying config...#012% Peer-group members must be all internal or all external.#012', stderr: '[1554|zebra] done#012[1570|staticd] done#012line 105: Failure to communicate[13] to bgpd, line: neighbor 20.0.0.1 peer-group PEER_V4#012#012[1560|bgpd] Configuration file[/etc/frr/frr.conf] processing failure: 13#012[1553|mgmtd] done#012'
```
The code can't run into the new FT2 use_vtysh path because get_bgp_confed_asn returns None as confed_asn is not configured.

> @shitalpatil148 could you help to clarify how it passed before if it would fail with PR testing on KVM?

This passed previously because it was executed on physical testbeds.

PR testing runs on VS/KVM, where ASIC and counters DB are not present, so CRM threshold validation is not applicable and may fail.

Skipping verify_thresholds() only when asic_type == "vs" prevents false PR failures, while full CRM validation continues to run on physical platforms.

Hi @nnelluri-cisco , do you know the tcp/udp port for HA? We'd better to specify the port for HA flows, otherwise the rule may capture test packets and cause unexpected behaviors

> Hi @nnelluri-cisco , do you know the tcp/udp port for HA? We'd better to specify the port for HA flows, otherwise the rule may capture test packets and cause unexpected behaviors

Hi @nnelluri-cisco , if we don't specify a port in the HA rules, any udp/tcp traffic will be sent to the VM, and if the dst match the default, traffic will be send back to dut, and if it match the default route again, there will be a loop. This will cause problem in other tests.

@congh-nvidia and @xixuej 
For DPU HA Flows the following L4 ports are used.

tcp 0 0 20.0.200.1:11362 0.0.0.0:* LISTEN - 
udp 0 0 20.0.200.1:11364 0.0.0.0:* -
thanks @nnelluri928 , is the tcp 11362 and udp 11364 listening on vm or on dut switch?

@xixuej 
tcp 11362 and udp 11364 are listening on the DPU.

After discussing the add cluster test case (to add configuration on a card with no previous cluster config), we have identified two options:

### Option 1

Create a custom minigraph via a functional test case:

- Remove the links of downstream LC and load this custom minigraph.
- The resulting config will not include cluster config, so we can test the operation via add.
- Revert to the original config by loading the original minigraph file.

### Status:

- Manually tested in Nokia lab.
- Requires additional automation effort (a few more days).

Minigraph changes required:

```
<CpgDec><PeeringSessions><BGPSession>
<CpgDec><Routers><a:BGPRouterDeclaration>
<DpgDec><DeviceDataPlaneInfo><PortChannelInterfaces><PortChannel>
<DpgDec><DeviceDataPlaneInfo><IPInterfaces><IPInterface>
<DpgDec><DeviceDataPlaneInfo><AclInterfaces><AclInterface>
<PngDec><DeviceInterfaceLinks><DeviceLinkBase>
<PngDec><Devices><Device i:type="LeafRouter">
```

### Option 2

Remove all cluster information in CONFIG_DB and save the configuration:

- Reboot the switch so it initializes with the saved configuration (without cluster config).
- Continue with testing only the add operation via patch.
- Revert to the original config by loading the minigraph.

### Status:

- Manually tested in Nokia lab.
- Changes already identified and ready to be committed.
- We suggest Option 2 as most appropriate for functional testing.

### Config DB table changes required:

> /localhost/ACL_TABLE/DATAACL/ports
> /localhost/ACL_TABLE/EVERFLOW/ports
> /localhost/ACL_TABLE/EVERFLOWV6/ports
> /localhost/BGP_NEIGHBOR
> /localhost/DEVICE_NEIGHBOR_METADATA
> /localhost/PORTCHANNEL
> /localhost/PORTCHANNEL_INTERFACE
> /localhost/PORTCHANNEL_MEMBER
> /localhost/INTERFACE
> 
> /asic/ACL_TABLE/DATAACL/ports
> /asic/ACL_TABLE/EVERFLOW/ports
> /asic/ACL_TABLE/EVERFLOWV6/ports
> /asic/BGP_NEIGHBOR
> /asic/DEVICE_NEIGHBOR
> /asic/DEVICE_NEIGHBOR_METADATA
> /asic/PORTCHANNEL
> /asic/PORTCHANNEL_INTERFACE
> /asic/PORTCHANNEL_MEMBER
> /asic/INTERFACE
> /asic/BUFFER_PG
> /asic/CABLE_LENGTH/AZURE
> /asic/PORT
> /asic/PORT_QOS_MAP


**Proposal:** Proceed with Option 2 for the functional test, since it is already validated and ready for commit.

Hi,

@reviewers Kindly asking for re-reviewing PR w.r.t. latest commit changes.

**Summary of Changes**

This commit introduces two types of changes/addresses following issues found:

1. Remove Cluster in max-topos

The operation for removing cluster information via GCU for max-topos was taking a long time to execute (e.g., an ASIC namespace with 18 ports required ~30 minutes).
The latest commit optimizes this by checking the number of active interfaces. For max-topos, the configuration is now removed using sonic-db-cli commands instead of GCU.
For min-topos, GCU continues to be used.
(A new Issue to be created to further investigate the delay in GCU-based removal.)

2. Unexpected ERR logs for ACL_TABLE/PORTCHANNEL in success apply-patch

After enabling loganalyzer in the latest commit, unexpected ERR logs appeared in syslog related to operations on ACL_TABLE and PORTCHANNEL tables. Although the apply-patch operation succeeds, these ERR logs are triggered by libyang validation.
New Issues have been created to track this behavior: [#24295](https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-buildimage/issues/24295) and [#24338](https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-buildimage/issues/24338).
As a workaround, the cluster addition process has been split into two separate operations:
- Add PORTCHANNEL information.
- Add the remaining cluster information.

Thanks,
Olympia
